desc: mCoverageCheck finds the subset of an image list that overlaps a region of interest.

arguments.name: mode
arguments.desc: There are six 'modes' of use, depending on the region to be checked is defined: 0 (POINTS), a set of convex polygon vertices; 1 (BOX), box center and sizes; 2 (CIRCLE), center and radius of a cone on the sky; 3 (POINT), a single point on the sky; 4 (HEADER), a FITS header template (file); and 5 (CUTOUT), like box but uses the full image file WCS and updates the record to indicate what subset of each image overlaps the box.

arguments.name: hdrfile
arguments.desc: FITS header template file; only used by mode 4 (HEADER) above.

arguments.name: narray
arguments.desc: Size of the 'array' of real numbers to use.

arguments.name: array
arguments.desc: Array of real numbers.  The size and use depend on mode.  For instance for mode 0 (POINTS) the number is twice the number of vertices in the polygon.

arguments.name: path
arguments.desc: Path to the data files (if we have them and want a double check on WCS info).

arguments.name: xoff
arguments.desc: Special check if sky wraparound is possible: recheck coverage with xoff, yoff applied).

arguments.name: yoff
arguments.desc: Special check if sky wraparound is possible: recheck coverage with xoff, yoff applied).
